results.title: The Expedition of T. Mitchell
results.brief_description:
The arrival of T.Mitchell from the United Kingdom to Australia with convicts in tow. Subsequently one morning, T.Mitchell awoke to find his camp robbed by the convicts.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Expanding universe of sculpture
results.brief_description: Explores contemporary sculpture, using as examples works by artists, Reuben Nakina, Alex Leberman, David Burt, and Doris Chase who express their attitudes toward their work and the philosophy that motivates them. Includes a multi-media show which combines music, dance, light and sculpture and demonstrates the uses of a wide variety of materials.

results.title: The Exorcist [DVD]
results.creator_credit: William Peter Blatty, Warner Bros Pictures and William Friedkin
results.brief_description: The Exorcist occupies a central position in the history of horror films, an almost sadistically malevolent experience in terror. Regan (Linda Blair) is a young girl entering puberty and she becomes possessed by the spirit of an ancient demon. Her mother (Ellen Burstyn) finds that there is no assistance in the scientific pragmatism of the modern world and she hesitantly turns to the occult rites of Catholicism and Orthodoxy in order to rid her daughter of the monster. The exorcism scenes attain a disturbing authenticity and they are based on the official Catholic Church rites of exorcism. “The Exorcist” is a film that feeds on our most intimate fears and terrors and not a film for the easily frightened. Stars Max Van Sydow as Father Merrin. Based on the book by William Peter Blatty. Mercedes McCambridge is the voice of the Devil. Part of Tubular Bell by Mike Oldfield used on the soundtrack.

results.title: The Existentialist cowboy's last stand
results.brief_description: Trapped up on a ridge, surrounded by a mean posse, a cowboy ponders his predicament - seeing it as a metaphor for life. Based on the book of the same name, this is French existentialism in a mid-Western American metaphor.

results.title: The Exceptional child
results.brief_description: A report on studies of children of unusual natural abilities or rate of development made in Great Britain, the United States and South Africa. Covers very rapid mental development, reading difficulties, stammering, accident proneness and delinquency, and evidence for pre-natal influence on these.

results.title: The Evolving world (NP)
results.creator_credit: Craig Saunders, Ashley Schwall-Kearney, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “The Global Economy”.
This episode of The Global Economy focuses on the changing nature of the world’s various economies by considering two examples: China as a developing economy (Passing on development) and the USA (Continual change, continual growth) with its dominance of the computer software industry. A panel of economists discuss the nature of change in the local market place and the effects this creates globally.

results.title: The Evolution of vascular plants: the ferns
results.brief_description: Describes the evolution of vascular systems in land plants. The highly specialised structures that occur in vascular plants are shown through investigation of the fern. The film explains the adaptive advantages of vascular systems in land plants, and shows how biologists reconstruct the story of the plant evolution by studying fossils and living plants.

results.title: The Evil one
results.brief_description: As the hunters return from their hunt, the tribe gathers around the fire to hear stories of the Dreamtime. In this story Marmoo, the Evil one tries to abduct two children and make them his slaves, but after a long chase they are rescued by the Winjarning Brothers, spirits from the heavens, who defeat Marmoo in an epic battle of minds which leaves Marmoo as an ant which then dies. An imaginative recreation of this Aboriginal legend, narrated by Belza Lowah.
